alert.note: Alert for Brewster (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 1:58AM CDT until May 27 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande at Castolon affecting Brewster County. Rio Grande at Johnson Ranch affecting Brewster County. For the Rio Grande...including Castolon, Johnson Ranch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Castolon. * WHEN...From early this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet (4.0 meters), the river reaches bankfull, and no significant damage is expected. At 15.0 feet (4.6 meters), the river reaches minor flood stage, and lowland flooding begins. The river begins to flood the road between Santa Elena Canyon and Cottonwood Campground in Big Bend National Park. The river begins to flood the parking lot at Santa Elena Canyon, and cut off the nature trail into the canyon. Campers in Cottonwood Campground need to prepare for possible evacuations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 9.7 feet (3.0 meters). - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 16.5 feet (5.0 meters) this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet (4.6 meters). - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet (5.3 meters) on 10/11/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Fri Fri Fri Sat Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7am 1pm 7pm 1am Rio Grande Castolon 15.0 9.7 Fri 1am 16.5 11.4 4.4 3.8 Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (meters): Fld Observed Fri Fri Fri Sat Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7am 1pm 7pm 1am Rio Grande Castolon 4.6 3.0 Fri 1am 5.0 3.5 1.3 1.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM CDT.
